column4: anyone know why I get this error when trying to install the fglrx drivers:
trying to overwrite '/usr/X11R6/bin/fgl_glxgears', which is also in package fglrx-6-8-0
then it says "dpkg-deb: subprocess paste killed by signal (Broken pipe)
I have two as well
and four have run linux at some point or another
or some variation of that
mp3 support can't be shipped because it has patent problems
no one is inforcing it though, which makes it somewhat more annoying...
imo, if Debian can ship something, everyone should feel safe to do the same...
I haven't researched the matter, I'm just saying what I've heard =)
didn't see your question... what was it?
dpkg --force-overwrite -i thepackage   (may need to apt-get -d install thepackage if you're getting it from online)
woot! thanks

current XChat, you can have it so that all that shows is the input field, any tabs, and the chat area, everything else can be hidden... looks simple and nice
the mplayer packages don't contain the i part
you probably want 'mplayer-686'
also... k7 is only a transition package... depending on k6
